metadata.Title: CVE-2023-30774 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the libtiff library. This flaw causes a heap buffer overflow issue via the TIFFTAG_INKNAMES and TIFFTAG_NUMBEROFINKS values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30774` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
libtiff-tools - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
libtiff5 - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
libtiffxx5 - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: 0xnishit> This CVE has the same fix as CVE-2022-3599. CVE-2022-3599 has already been fixed across releases.

criterions.comment: tiff package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2').
